content: Finally back in NYC, the city's hum is like a familiar tune. Just saw a guy playing the violin at the subway entrance - now that's how you welcome me back!
Set up my workstation. The skyline through my window is a constant reminder of why I love this city. Time to dive into some AI modeling work.
Walked by Bryant Park today. It's amazing how people here are so absorbed in their screens, almost like they're living in parallel realities.
Just had a meeting with some potential collaborators. Their enthusiasm for AI in finance is contagious. Can't wait to see where this goes.
Had a deep conversation with a friend about the nature of reality. If we're in a simulation, does that make our experiences any less real?
Celebrated my 22nd birthday with a slice of pizza from my favorite spot. Turning 22 in NYC feels like the beginning of a new chapter.
The subway ride this morning was a microcosm of human behavior. From the guy with his briefcase to the kid playing on his tablet - it's all there.
Spent the day coding. The more I work with AI, the more I realize how much we're becoming intertwined with technology. It's both exciting and a bit eerie.
